A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her progress, various sorts of turmoil in her Dallastown, Pennsylvania, family life are brought to light, and capped by tragedy. Jockey Robert Redford has the horse and steers the family unit. Other performers include Mickey Rooney , Juliet Mills , and Piper Laurie .

Pierce Brosnan has sipped his last Martini and returns, in an outrageous self-parody, as the aging foul-mouthed boozy assassin Julian — a successor to James Bond — with one foot in the grave. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: "Early Years" and "Adult." The first part covers the time Kenji went to his childhood friend Shizue's family house in order to study. The two fall for each other, but everything changes when they receive the sudden news of Kenji's parents' death.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the cat, and the cat has an agenda of its own, but it ultimately runs out and loves her again.
What starts off with an intriguing premise and some genuinely fun moments, but the film itself is a mess, with characters wildly changing their positions of loyalty,
